programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Toronto, Ontario
Heading for Toronto to catch and move a marmot!
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: At home with the monks in Saint-Jean-de-Matha Christian spends some time in Saint-Jean-de-Matha, a peaceful, boreal setting, with the Cistercian monks from the Abbaye Val Notre-Dame, Micheline Lanctôt, Pierre Thibault and the chef Arnaud Marchand, from Chez Boulay, the boreal bistro in Quebec. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: The modern family garden Can a landscape gardener be happy with a plot measuring just 200 square metres? Simon Rüegg says yes. For his family he has organised each corner of his garden such that everyone enjoys it, making the most of it and feeling at home. And all that with style and elegance. Presented by: Katharina Locher.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Maisons-Alfort National Veterinary School. Encounter with Amélie Viaene, a multi-facetted jeweller. Along the Seine, three go-to addresses for everything to do with fishing. Cow bells, the sound and know-how of age-old traditions. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Ramara, Ontario
Behind the walls of a house: an invasion of bees! Louis will do his best to resolve this case.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Rudimentary cuisine Christian gathers everyone together for a rudimentary meal with a recipe from François Papineau, conserves from Bob le Chef and fondu from Réal Bossé. Mathieu Hébert grills the meat and smokes the fish without a stove or a pan. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: The peony garden Katharina Shepherd spent ten years living in Japan, which was where she developed her passion for peonies. In her magnificent garden with a view of Lake Thun, she grows a range of rare species. Presented by: Katharina Locher.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the library of the National Institute for Art History. Encounter with the French photographer Carole Bellaïche. Exploring Paris on the trail of a daring scientist: Marie Curie. Focus on Simon, a craftsman armed with patience and passion, who reveals the skills of a rare profession: luthier. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Best of design Behind the scenes at the Maison de la Radio, Paris. Style enjoys a breath of fresh air with the bucolic creations by designer Éric Schmitt. Paris, in the footsteps of Le Corbusier. Ceramic with decorative weaving thanks to the magical hands of Silver Sentimenti. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Aunis
In the Natural Region of the Aunis, Claire and Vincent gather seaweed from the Pointe du Chay headland, before transforming it into something totally delicious. Benoît and François farm mussels to sample directly on the quayside. We also meet Fabrice, an encounter between surf and turf. All about Surgères butter.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Dijon: a shrine to owls Dijon is the capital of Burgundy and also the land of the owl! This nocturnal bird is the town's symbol and is found just about everywhere. as a constant source of inspiration for the Dijon's residents! Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 6:

Spotlight on French-style gastronomy and high-end dining thanks to tableware from the Sèvres Manufactory. How to wear a cap backwards and pastel colours. Parisian blazers by Capucine Martin. In Strasbourg, the Au Fond du Jardin tea rooms have made the madeleine its speciality, and offer a surprising range.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Éric Pras (2/2)
In the company of the Burgundy chef Éric Pras, we discover one of France's most emblematic wine-growing areas. An opportunity to follow a culinary trail that continues in Dijon, in the heart of the International Centre for Gastronomy and Wine, and witness a "battle" between two exceptional young chefs.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life on a smallholding In Alberta, Roger and Virginie live on their smallholding with their three children. The couple like keeping certain traditions alive, such as bringing in the hay, and rope Julien in to lend a hand. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Cranberry-cinnamon brioche
To highlight the arrival at the newsagents of the Christmas magazine, Ricardo prepares the recipe that features on the cover: a festive cranberry-cinnamon brioche wreath.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
Sept-Îles, protecting the seabirds
Just offshore from Brittany's Côte de Granit Rose, the Sept-Îles archipelago is a nature reserve that offers a safe haven for the largest population of seabirds in metropolitan France. No easy matter, when we know that between 1950 and 2010, the global seabird population declined by nearly 70%. Report by: Corentin Pichon.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Cordouan lighthouse that guards the mouth of the Gironde estuary. Encounter with Jean-Michel Othoniel, artist, creating poetical yet militant sculptures. A stroll through Paris to discover some of its best Art Nouveau addresses. Focus on Aurore Thuault, a textile designer turning embroidery into contemporary art. Presented by: Katherina Marx.
